title: Searching for Meaning in the Life of Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf: A Call to Meaningful Responses to Tragedies - PMC

quotes: She acquired a master’s degree in public administration from Harvard University in 1971.
In 1979, Johnson-Sirleaf was appointed the first female Minister of Finance in Liberia under President William Tolbert.
In 1980, President Tolbert was removed and executed in a coup d’état led by General Samuel Doe.
she had to escape the country with the help of the World Bank in 1980.
In 1984, she returned to Liberia as she felt compelled to serve her country.
Instead of moving overseas, in 1985 she contested and won the elections for a senatorial seat.
In 1986, upon being released from prison, she went into exile to escape the increasingly oppressive military government.
